intro: Goniothalamus sesquipedalis, commonly known as the giant water fig, is a tropical tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its large, smooth, gray bark and broad, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces fragrant, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by large, fleshy, orange-red fruits. Its botanical features make it a notable species in rainforest ecosystems, though it is relatively rare and faces conservation challenges.
